titleStmt.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to James D. Porter, April 19, 1887

bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to James D. Porter
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Mr. S. S. Sevier
To the Asst. Secy of State.
Receipt of schedule stating appropriations for diplomatic and Consular service for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1888.
Stationary for the Consular agent at Cape Coast Castle has been forwarded by Despatch Agency at London.

Hon. Jas. D. Porter
Ass't Secretary of State
Washington D.C.

I have the honor to inform you that the schedule or circular stating appropriations for diplomatic and Consular service by the government of the United States for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1888 has been received. Stationary for the Consular Agency at Cape Coast Castle has been forwarded
forwarded by your despatch Agency at London.

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your obedient servant
Saml. S. Sevier
U.S Vice Consul Genl
div1.fw:
Hon. J. D. Porter
Ass't Secr'y of State
Washington D.C.
